skill.name: sca-blackduck
skill.description: Software Composition Analysis (SCA) using Synopsys Black Duck for identifying open source vulnerabilities, license compliance risks, and supply chain security threats with CVE, CWE, and OWASP framework mapping. Use when: (1) Scanning dependencies for known vulnerabilities and security risks, (2) Analyzing open source license compliance and legal risks, (3) Identifying outdated or unmaintained dependencies, (4) Integrating SCA into CI/CD pipelines for continuous dependency monitoring, (5) Providing remediation guidance for vulnerable dependencies with CVE and CWE mappings, (6) Assessing supply chain security risks and third-party component threats.

security_audit.summary: This skill consists entirely of documentation, configuration templates, and CI/CD workflow examples. No executable scripts or code that could pose security risks were found. The skill provides legitimate security guidance for dependency scanning and license compliance.

content.user_title: Scan dependencies for vulnerabilities and license compliance
content.value_statement: Open source dependencies often contain known vulnerabilities and license compliance risks. This skill integrates Synopsys Black Duck SCA to automatically detect vulnerabilities, map findings to CVE/CWE/OWASP frameworks, and enforce license compliance policies in CI/CD pipelines.
actual_capabilities: Scan project dependencies for known vulnerabilities using Black Duck Detect
Map vulnerability findings to CVE, CWE, and OWASP Top 10 categories
Analyze open source license compliance and identify risky licenses
Generate Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) in CycloneDX or SPDX formats
Integrate SCA scanning into GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, and Jenkins pipelines
Apply security policies that fail builds on critical and high severity vulnerabilities
limitations: Requires Synopsys Black Duck subscription or on-premise installation
API token and Black Duck URL must be configured as environment variables
Does not perform SAST or DAST - only dependency composition analysis
Scans are executed by external Black Duck Detect tool, not by this skill

use_cases.title: Vulnerability monitoring
use_cases.description: Continuously monitor production dependencies for new CVEs and enforce remediation SLAs

use_cases.title: CI/CD security gates
use_cases.description: Block deployments when critical or high severity vulnerabilities are detected in dependencies

use_cases.title: License compliance audits
use_cases.description: Identify GPL, AGPL, and other restricted licenses that may create legal liability

prompt_templates.title: Quick dependency scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Scan this project for dependency vulnerabilities using Black Duck. Show me all critical and high severity findings with their CVE numbers, affected versions, and remediation recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: License compliance check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the dependencies in this project and identify any license compliance risks. Categorize by risk level and suggest alternatives for high risk licenses like GPL or AGPL.

prompt_templates.title: CI/CD integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GitHub Actions workflow that runs Black Duck SCA on every pull request and fails the build if any critical vulnerabilities are found.

prompt_templates.title: SBOM generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a CycloneDX SBOM for this project showing all direct and transitive dependencies with their license information and version numbers.

output_examples.input: Scan this project and show critical vulnerabilities with remediation guidance
output: Fix Available: Upgrade to 2.17.2 or later
Remediation: Update log4j-core version in pom.xml
Fix Available: Upgrade to 0.17.0 or later

best_practices: Run Black Duck scans on every pull request to catch new vulnerabilities before merge
Configure policy to fail builds on critical and high severity findings
Generate and archive SBOMs for every release for supply chain transparency
Document risk acceptance decisions with business justification and review dates
anti_patterns: Ignoring low severity vulnerabilities without assessment - they can escalate
Using latest dependency versions without scanning first - may introduce risks
Skipping scans in CI/CD for faster builds - increases deployment risk
Accepting all vulnerabilities without remediation - accumulates technical debt

faq.question: What Black Duck subscription is required?
faq.answer: Requires Black Duck on-premise or hosted subscription with API access. Contact Synopsys for pricing.

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Supports all major languages: JavaScript, Python, Java, Go, Ruby, .NET, PHP, Rust, C/C++, and Docker containers.

faq.question: How are credentials secured?
faq.answer: API tokens must be set as environment variables (BLACKDUCK_URL, BLACKDUCK_TOKEN) in CI/CD secrets, never in code.

faq.question: Does this replace SAST tools?
faq.answer: No. Black Duck SCA analyzes dependencies. Use SAST tools like Semgrep or CodeQL for application code security.

faq.question: What happens to cached results?
faq.answer: Temporary files are cleaned up by default. Configure cleanup settings to retain results for compliance if needed.

faq.question: How does it compare to free tools?
faq.answer: Black Duck provides comprehensive vulnerability database, license compliance, and enterprise features. Free alternatives include OWASP Dependency-Check.
